page.title: 11CROSS HOUSES HOSPITAL
page.content: The Hospital was built in 1834 as a {Workhouse.}During the 1914-18 War it became a hospital for{wounded soldiers and in 1925 became a{General and {Maternity}Hospital. In 1967 it became a{Geriatric Hospital.}The 3 storied building has 5 wards - one is a small surgical unit with its own theatre. There are about 84 beds in use. There is a kitchen. Dirty laundry is sent to the Royal Shrewsbury Hospital. There is a physiotherapy unit and an X-Ray department. The cuts in the National Health Service money and the requirements for the planned Telford Hospital means that{closure announcements for Cross Houses Hospital are expected shortly. Patients will likely transfer to Shrewsbury and the building become an office administration block for the Area Health Authority.
